snippet: Some doctors at New York City’s biggest private hospital system appear to no longer accept certain plans, forcing some patients to change doctors.
abstract: Some doctors in the Mount Sinai Health System, New York City's biggest private hospital system, are no longer accepting certain low-cost insurance plans, which is preventing a number of patients from seeing their longtime doctors; it is unclear whether changes are limited to a few doctors or part of a movement by institution to squeeze out low-paying plans under health care reform law or force higher reimbursement rates.
lead_paragraph: Some doctors at New York City’s biggest private hospital system appear to no longer accept certain plans, forcing some patients to change doctors.

headline.main: Patients Fear Mt. Sinai Will Drop Low-Cost Insurance Plans
headline.print_headline: Patients Fear Mount Sinai Will Drop Low-Cost Insurance Plans

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
